name: Ari
text: I have a very hit or miss experience with Chick-Fil-A as of late. I've been shorted food, been given medium drinks when I pay for large, but occasionally I get amazing service with no problems. So it depends on when you go I suppose.

name: Sunny Cooper
text: It's a great place family friendly

name: Amber Turrentine
text:
I have never seen a Chick-fil-A  so unorganized and rude. We have been there a few times and generally get met with service that is mediocre at best. None of the employees ever look happy or offer that great customer service Chick-fil-A  is known for.

Today was beyond frustrating and caused me to be late for work. I placed a pick up order and at 12:24. At 12:33 I recieved the notification that my food was ready. At 12:41 my food still wasn't  ready. The employees were not wanting to help. Finally one asked me to provide my receipt. Turns out that my food was on the counter the entire time and it was cold by the time I got it at 12:47.

name: Favor Favor
text: This chic fila location has gone down in service. Must’ve hired new management and workers. The Food is cold at times. Fries were undercooked last time I went. They are Not as friendly as the other Chic fila locations. I May as well go mcdonalds somewhere.  Out of the last 5 times I’ve ordered at the Daphne location, there has been something wrong with my food. They need to get it together. There are several other people complaining about this location as well. Chic Fila is the only fast restaurant I’ll eat at, but I’ve finally decided not to order anything from this location anymore. I go out of my way now to go to the or Spanish Fort or Foley location...

name: Kimberly Zimmerman
text: This is my first time in the restaurant. It's crazy busy @1PM. The decor is nice with fresh flowers on all of the tables. The employees have been very attentive. My food came out fast. There were plenty of tables to sit at even though it is so busy. So glad I came in! Oh and the new market salad is amazing!

The food and ppl are great. But my only complaint is there ICE COFFEE  its never mixed or stirred and when ur driving its very difficult. ALSO half the time its good and the other half its bitter. So if u order ice coffee its a 50/50. Other then that its a great place customer service us spot on and deserve 5 stars.
Ice coffee deserve 2/ 3 stars

Also, in a random act of kindness, the guy in front of me at the drive through paid for my meal.  Dang, even the patrons are nice.  Anyway, thank you random Chick-fil-A customer.  Perhaps someday, I can purchase you a #1 meal with cola.

name: Zach Taylor
text: Bad experience I always choose curbside delivery and I ordered my wife a chicken meal and when I arrived home to give her biscuit meal. The chicken was extremely small and burned and soon as she took a bite immediately said she didn’t want it anymore. We order from y’all every week often and to spend money on a biscuit meal have it burned and very small piece of chicken is not good at all. I don’t know who would want to eat and small piece of chicken that is burned. Whoever prepared this meal did not seem to care about the customers at all. The nearest chick fla is in mobile that I know of and I’m really thinking about taking my business. Only good thing about the meal was the sweet tea and the hash browns. Biscuit was terrible!! 11/28/2017

name: Leif VanHorn
text: I just went to chic fil a on 98 at daphne today. The experience was amazing. It was supposedly  "cow day." Every one wore spotted shirts and got discounts. There were families and children,  happy, all around, yet there still enough room for me to dine in yet this was meant to be more of a smaller drive through store.  I had my food within five minutes. Unlike a lot of restaurants the credit card swipe machine worked fast and smoothly. My food tasted great. A manager even sat down and interviewed me with my experience (I ate in). I had a iced coffee and it was surprisingly tasty. The servers were very generous happy, friendly,  and giggling while maintaining a serious working mentality. I recommend this to anyone coming to this chic fil a location. - Leif

name: Nick/Slagarp

text: This is my favorite Chick-fil-A in the area. The drive-thru is always fast; at their busiest times, they have people taking orders on tablets. The employees are mostly friendly, and even the ones who aren't friendly are professional and proficient. The food is great (of course). I've never gotten a wrong order or a bad order. The only thing to be aware of is that there are students from a local school who often come here during lunch, so it may be extra busy from time to time.

name: Steven Bradley
text:
Edit: One of the worst experiences this trip. Slowest service ever at any CFA. After we received our order (it had an error), I had to walk back up to the register where I was ignored by several staff members, and a manager who walked by multiple times.

The "chick-fil-a app" is pure garbage. It crashes constantly while trying to place an order. After finally getting an order placed, it showed ready for pick up. The staff had no clue how to fulfill the order. I had to wait for a manager to look at my phone, and he hesitantly filled the order.

Previous visit: Fast, polite, and great food!

Also, one of the few fast food chains that still has a play area!

My kids always pick Chick-fil-A.

text: It usually seems chaotic inside and outside the building, although the employees are nice. It's fast food, so I don't really feel the need to explain the quality of the food, but if you're in need of a quick protein meal I would choose here over most places. Price is average for what you get. They REALLY need to fix the drive-thru situation, though. Their drive-thru lines block traffic for Target customers and people trying to navigate on Hwy 98. Which, really, is more-so an issue with the level of ignorance and self-centeredness of their customers who willingly block traffic just to use the drive-thru, when there are myriad parking spaces available...but I digress.

text: I just had an experience that I've never had before at a Chick-fil-A. I pulled up to the restaurant at 6:05 and my food was not handed to me until 6:40. I waited in the drive thru line for 5 minutes that was at standstill and then I decided to go inside.  The two cashiers had a dazed look on their face as they slowly waited on customers which took 10 minutes and then I stood there waiting on my food for another 20 minutes. mind you that it was dinner time and the server told me that the holdup was that they were waiting on the two Chick-fil-A sandwiches. Entertainment that I had during this whole weight was watching the employees slowly sonder back and forth behind the counter.

name: Cornelia Thrash
text:
Boi did I have to work for this food! 3 times I ordered the fried fish and shrimp and 3 times they brought out a partial order! I must say, "They weren't even worth the wait! The only seasoning I could taste was the pepper. The onion rings were free due to the constant order mix-up. I'm glad cause if I had paid for them the level of disappointment would have been overwhelming. They are the low quality frozen onion rings that has the very thin supposedly sliced onion that has no onion flavor that's breaded in breading that has no flavor! I also ordered the crawfish that's boil-in-bag with potatoes,  sausage,  and corn. I imagine it would have tasted alright if I could have eaten it! There was so much grease in the bag and on the food I was afraid to try it! I don't know if the grease came from the cheap sausage that was included or if they added margarine thinking that would add flavor. The corn literally had to be rung out with paper towels before it was edible!
All-in-all the jewel in this experience was the waitress Ashanti! Her patience and her professionalism spoke volumes! Not once did she even sigh amidst the order mishaps. Thank you Ashanti! I only wish that all those who work in customer service had your attitude,  patience,  and humility!

resp.text:
Hi,Cornelia.
Thank you for your time to give us a feedback.

first of all,I’m glad you like Ashanti’s work! We’ll pass along the kind words.”

Secondly,I’m sorry your experience with us didn’t go well.

We use Conecuh original smoke sausage,I think it is pretty good quality and it’s local favorites.
And Our fried onion is one of our popular items ,that’s why we gave it on the house as we made a mistake on your foods. I’m sorry you didn’t like it.

Our seafood served in the bag,It’s kinda a trend in big cities like New York and Atlanta.I understand that some people not familiar with it,since it is different from local .

And also Our seafood boil is served with our house sauces,which contains butter,And they all taste great,It’s new and different from local ,but we have confidence that our seafood boil soon will become a favorite to the local.

name: Eric Richardson
text: We had fried oysters and calamari appetizers as well as steamed King crab and shrimp with corn, potatoes and sausage. The menu says steamed, which I usually equate with bland. Royals great seasonings and spices, however, make it more like the great boiled seafood South Louisiana is so famous for, and far from bland. We especially liked that Royal offers several different seasoning combinations levels as well as heat levels. It was all very fresh and delicious. Service was great -attentive but not bothersome. Very clean and spacious. I highly recommend Royal Seafood.

resp.text: We are grateful for your kind words and your time to leave us this amazing reviews,Thanks for sharing your review with us and the community.

name: Matt Simon
text: This is a hidden gem!! The food and service was great. If you are looking for great seafood, go here!!  Better than all the other places on Airport Blvd. (And better prices). We had a great mix of food and it was all great and cooked perfectly.

resp.text:
Thanks for leaving our business a 5-star rating, Matt. I’m glad that you had wonderful experience with us.

Your review,WAW! one of my favorites,it means a lot to our team,thank you so much,it’s truly appreciated!

name: Joshua Chancey
text: Service and food is amazing. Me and my kids loved the presentation of the steamed seafood bags on the platter as well as getting to wear the crab bibs. The butter seasoning sauce on the shrimp and crawfish is some of the best I've ever tasted. Will be back again soon!

resp.text:
Thank you so much for taking the time to leave us this amazing review.
Looking forward to seeing you soon

text: I wasn't impressed by any means. The cup that I got had nasty residue all around the rim. The forks were bent to the point of where they were just impossible to use. It's a little pricey for what you get, but the seafood did have good flavor. I think I'll just make the drive to the causeway the next time I go out for seafood.

resp.text:
Hi,Julia.

While It’s great you like our seafood flavor,I apologize for the cup and fork,it’s an uncommon instance,thank you for bring this to my attention,we will fix it right away and ensure this won’t happen again.
Looking forward to seeing you soon.

My wife got the garlic butter crawfish and hasn’t stopped talking about how flavorful it is. We will be back

text: Just looking at the menu. Crawfish $10.00 a lb ? Lol y’all are smoking crack. Especially when you can buy crawfish for half that somewhere else

resp.text:
Hi,Joshua .thank you for your time to write us your opinion.

You are right that you can buy crawfish for half somewhere else.

Just so you know that our crawfish comes with corn,potato,and sausage.

Please take this for consideration... that price are not only food costs, but also labor costs, rent, taxes, insurance, maintenance and so on.

Our menu isn’t perfect for everyone,but everyone’s opinion is valuable to us. If necessary,we will optimize our menu to meet the most people’s needs.

Thank you!
